intro: Ludia glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth ludia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of ponds. Ludia glaberrima is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
